messages.message: Tried using the new refiner project template, and upon running the first step of the flow ( process files), as a single step, it comes up with a output as shown, however, it also has a bin folder containing the workflow.ibflow , on trying to open that, it keep loading and doesn’t open, can anyone explain me why this happens?, the file marked *1 keeps loading and fails to open?*
Confirm this behavior.
I have this as well
HI @pankaj.hazra (first of all, nice to meet you!). I can take a look. Could you share use `eob` on your repository?
(or @tomas, @Felicia do you have a link to a folder demonstrating the problem?)

@Ted here: https://dogfood.instabase.com/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/bin-error-example/

project created with review refiner 5 creator, created a new flow called `buggy_flow.ibflow` with one process files step using Marx and standard json settings, ran on input folder
with compile as binary ON
Was the bug in the files created by the installer wizard?
just ran the post install script flow and getting same error
Yeah I see this in the flow that is auto-generated
```No files were processed successfully in Apply Refiner. populateArgs is missing from this program. Old style refiner programs are deprecated. Please recreate this program.```
Hey @Ted,can you share your username, as I ain’t able to add you as a collaborator in the repo!  or does link sharing work fine? and could you please elaborate on what `eob`  means?
My username is `eob` :slightly_smiling_face:
But I think I also have enough to try to reproduce -- thank you for the bug report!
I'm seeing a slightly different bug when I reproduce, so trying to see if they're different artifacts of the same thing or different thigns.
this ibflow inside bin is supposed to be the actual workflow.ibflow in the root folder or it was not intended to be there?
If it's Flow-related @dlluncor will be a good router. If it's Refiner-related, @lydia will be a good router. I'm actually not sure myself which it is.

This looks like the default Refiner program / Flow setup using the wizard is not valid given our Flow / Refiner configuration expectations. @Ted, @lydia I'd say Doc Insight - Apps team should own this and work with who might have setup the Refiner program template
@dlluncor if you're responding to my bug report; ignore it: we've handled it separately
@dlluncor what configuration is it missing that flow is just showing a spinner?
Would you say the same for the initial screenshot?
(the one where the `ibflow` got put in the `bin` directory)
My mistake mixing bug reports on one conversation thread; ran into Bug 2 while hunting Bug 1 :slightly_smiling_face:

Happy to take a look at the configuration if you could send it @lydia. 

@Ted we are supposed to save the ibflowbin to the bin/ directory. I've never seen ibflow show up there, so I need to understand how this was configured
@pankaj.hazra reported the initial bug. can you share the link to the created ibfow?
or @tomas @Felicia can you share a link?

https://dogfood.instabase.com/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/bin-error-example/

project created with review refiner 5 creator, created a new flow called `buggy_flow.ibflow` with one process files step using Marx and standard json settings, ran on input folder with compile binary ON
If you can create a JIRA for this happy to take a look if you tag me. Might lose track if it all stays in Slack. Thanks!
@dlluncor what is the process for Flow Jira tickets?

lol flow file is gibberish so that's probably the issue https://dogfood.instabase.com/apps/text-editor/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/bin-error-example/Refiner5%20bin%20error/out/bin/workflow.ibflow
@Ted might that be a recipe book issue where it's dumping some error stack into the file instead of copying the file?

Oh it could definitely be a Recipebook issue -- that's why I jumped into the thread to try to figure out!

You're looking at something in a `bin` directory though. It could also be gibberish because it's a binary file misnamed

For Flow Execution engine, you can assign to Shaunak and he will route. For Flow features you can assign to me and I will route. Flow Execution Engine is Fow stability, how Flow executes, and the underlying way it deals with files and passes them to steps .

Flow Features are all the logic that goes into a step
Yeah, I htink it's a flow bug
If you rename it to `.ibflowbin` it runs just fine
Man. I always feel good when a bug reveals itself to be 1LoC fix. It looks as if the binarization process just gave the file the wrong extension
https://dogfood.instabase.com/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/bin-error-example/Refiner5%20bin%20error/out/bin/
Hopping out of the thread since it seems not recipe book related.
@dlluncor if you have a link to the flow jira i'm happy to file a ticket
On my phone so can't get to JIRA easily. An email for now will suffice too
Done! :raised_hands:
